Html:
Hi! If you want to contribute, please do!

I'm working on a more formal roadmap, but here are some short-term goals:
  • OpenID
  • Support all Countries
  • Exploit Virtual Earth's APIs more
  • RSS Feeds for all pages
  • iCal downloads for all events
  • "My" Dinners
  • Mobile version of the site
  • Twitter integration? Facebook integration?
  • Blog Badges showing nearby dinners with automatic geo-location.
  • As many Tests and as much Coverage as we can stomach.
  • Continuous Integration Server somewhere?
If you want to work on something, propose a general design here in the discussions, take feedback and go do it! Then, post the feature in the Patches section of the Releases tab.

1. I want to contribute to the project, i wrote some code, but how will i post the patches?
  2. when i checkout the code, some tests fails

I'd second the motion.  How do we apply patches? 

Volkanuzun: tests seems to fail b/c there is not enough data for certain tests.

Hm..I'll check the tests again. Which download has failing tests?

You can submit patches under the "Source Code" tab.
any specs for implementing my dinner section? or can i start writing that section :)
This discussion has been copied to a work item. Click here to go to the work item and continue the discussion.

I had some problems submitting a TortoiseSVN generated .patch file.  I get a nice red error message saying the patch file could not be read whenever I try to submit the patch.  I don't know if this is because I already submitted a patch with just the class file (.cs file).

Has anyone else had any problems submitting a .patch file that was generated with the Tortoise client?  I'm on Vista 32bit with VS 2008 Professional.

Guys,

the source code is not the same version that is @ nerddinner.com. Is the latest one available somewhere? I want to specifically look at OpenID and some other implementations.

It's in the source code tab.

--
Scott Hanselman - Tiny phone, tiny email
